fields.description:
I've created an automation rule based on a workflow in our 'Releases'-project. This project 'Releases' contains all stories to initiate the deployment process of a created software product. Each story is linked to the project and the corresponding release. My aim is to automatically set the status of the release either to 'Release' or 'Archive' depending on the outcome of release story. I've got to work but it would be great make it more efficient and easier to maintain. In the 'Release Version'-step I must select the specific project 'KEN'. Leaving it to the current project leads into failing the rule. This is off course the version is located in de 'KEN'-project and not in the 'Release'-project.

!image-2021-01-04-08-41-11-266.png!

!image-2021-01-04-08-41-29-730.png!
fields.summary: Dynamic project selection based on variables

h3. Issue Summary

Opening the Jira macOS native app on BigSur machine causes an app crash

The app opens and work as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the "Export Word" option, the dates (created date, comment date etc.) are presented in GST time
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# set your timezone to Sydney (GMT + 11)
# create a ticket before 11:00am on a certain date
# run export to word and check the created date - it will show the day before. ie: GMT time

h3. Expected Results
Created Date in the export to word output should respect the user's timezone prefrence

h3. Actual Results
Created date in the export for word is showing GMT time

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Export to Word function displaying incorrect dates

fields.description:
{panel:title=Description update 03-Fev-2020}
Every user in Jira Software can create Scrum and Kanban board in classic projects. 
As a Jira admin would be important to restrict users from creating new board with specific permission for it.
{panel}

h3. Summary

Currently, every licensed user in Jira has the ability of creating a board. They can also opt to share the board or keep it private for themselves.

That can be problematic in scenarios where there are a big number of users from different teams, where Jira admins need more control over the things that are created within the instance. Specially because non-shared boards will not be visible for the admins either.

h3. Suggestion

Create a specific permission that will be required in order to create boards.
fields.summary: Specific permission to create an Agile board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Viewing a non-image attachment in emails does not show as a hyperlink but as a static image preview.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have someone add a non-image file (e.g. .txt file) and mention so you will receive an email notification.
 # View the email

h3. Expected Results
The attachment in the email notification is rendered as a hyperlink to directly download it.

h3. Actual Results
The attachment in the email notification is rendered as a static image preview and there is no hyperlink to download the attachment.

h3. Workaround
Reach out to Jira Cloud support and we can have our team disable the new Jira email experience temporarily so that it will render these attachments as hyperlinks.
fields.summary: Viewing a non-image attachment in emails does not show as a hyperlink

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer would like to see a build-in feature in Jira which displays the projects which have no open issues. This is not achievable by just JQL.
 They control the billing by revoking the license of their customer users once their projects are executed and completed.As of now they do this manually and would be great if this can be automated

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a report to allow users filtering projects by issues resolution/status
fields.summary: Ability to list projects where all issues are completed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Filter result gadget doesn't show the updated content/result upon browser refresh. It will only get updated after some time, or if we change the gadget configuration by adding/removing a column. 
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 filters with the following JQL:
#* Project = ABC and status = "Work in Progress"
#* Project = ABC and status = "Pending"
# Create a dashboard with 2 "Filter Results" gadgets in it
# Associate each filter with each gadget
# Create a ticket and transition it to either "Work in Progress" and "Pending"
# Open the dashboard and refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

The gadget should show the updated issue in the correct gadget
*  [^Screen Recording 2021-01-11 at 6.37.19 PM.mov] 

h3. Actual Results

The gadget does not show the updated issue until some time.

h3. Workaround

* Manually change the gadget configuration
* Or, wait a little bit longer.
fields.summary: Filter Result gadget doesn't show updated result upon page refresh

fields.description:
*Requirement:* Related Issue Number should display even when a user doesn't have access to that related project but can be disabled since the user will be unable to access it.

*Use Case:* 

User "John" has access to projects SAMPLE and PRODUCTION.
User "Elizabeth" has access only to project SAMPLE.

The project SAMPLE has a ticket SAMPLE-1001 related to a ticket PRODUCTION-9876.

When on the ticket description page of SAMPLE-1001, "John" is able to see the Linked Issue where as for "Elizabeth" the linked issue is not at all displaying. This masking here misses to represent the link.

 

*Suggestion:* Linked issue PRODUCTION-9876 to be displayed for "Elizabeth" while viewing the ticket SAMPLE-1001, but the hyperlink can be disabled. This will facilitate the user to understand there is a parent / related ticket to this issue and can contact the respective team for additional clarity on need basis.

 

Thanks.

Reference URL: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Related-Issue-should-display-only-even-when-a-user-doesn-t-have/qaq-p/1574273?utm_campaign=mentions_answer&utm_content=post&utm_medium=email&utm_source=atlcomm**
fields.summary: Related Issue # should display (only) even when a user doesn't have access to that related project

h3. Issue Summary

The JQL search doesn't return issues with empty values in the "Epic Link" field when using the clause "Epic Link" !='

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Going Back from one issue to another causes issues with mentions and this causes confusion when trying to tag users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1- Open any ticket from Project X.
2- In the same tab, open any ticket from Project Y (users that have access to Project X should be different that the users that have access to Project Y).
3- Open the comment section and type @ followed by any Jira user who has access to project Y, note the users that appear.
4- Click Back in the web browser.
5- Now that we're back in the first ticket opened in project X,  go to the comment section and press "@".

h3. Expected Results
The users with access (according to permissions) to the project/issue should appear in the list.

h3. Actual Results
The list of users that appear are the ones from the other issue/project (project Y).

h3. Workaround
Refreshing the page after going back solves the issue.
fields.summary: Going Back from one issue to another causes issues with mentions

fields.description:
_Reopening this Bug https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71384 as it is still causing some confusion to our customers._

h3. Summary

In Jira cloud, the [CHART]Time in Status which is using the customer field type *Time in Status* is used for reporting in [average time in status gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-use-average-time-in-status-gadget-776998092.html]. Within the custom field configuration, a user is allowed to create a custom field using the *Time in Status* type. This can further be misinterpreted as a standard field type containing data that is user readable.  


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new custom field
# Choose the type *Time in Status*.


h3. Expected Results

*Time in Status* should not be configurable as this field type is not meant to contain data that can be directly used by end users. 

h3. Actual Results

*Time in Status* can be configured and further be added to screens. The actual field created cannot be edited nor viewed. 

h3. Note 

JRACLOUD-60841 is the existing feature request to actually allow reporting of time in status for individual Jira issues.
fields.summary: Misleading Time in Status custom field type

fields.description:
As a Jira Classic project admin

I want the non-working days calendar to be a fixed size

To reduce my entry errors when entering dates

 

Acceptance criteria:
 * The calendar widget is a fixed size, large enough to hold all month names
 * The navigation buttons in the widget remain in fixed locations

 

Business case:

The current calendar widget for non-working days entry dynamically changes in size based upon the length of the month name and year.  When trying to navigate time by clicking on the month or year buttons, the widget changes size, and so the navigation buttons move.  For example, when repeatedly clicking on a month button, the size changes, resulting in the year button ending up under the cursor, and so changing the wrong thing: year rather than month.
fields.summary: ,make non-working days calendar widget fixed size

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is a setting in the *General configuration* called *Allow unassigned issues*.

If you turn that off, you won't be able to create or edit the form of existing issue collectors.

When trying to do so, the error message states the following:
{code}
You cannot create an issue collector for this project, because the following fields are required on the project and those field types cannot be displayed to anonymous users. If the field is changed to be optional or a default…
{code}

That's contradictory. 

The issue creation flow works the same from any source. 

When you turn off *Allow unassigned issues*, you are required to have a default assignee in the projects. Even if you do not have the *Assignee* field be displayed in the create screen, the issue is created and the default assignee is set. That refutes the statement that says the *Assignee* field cannot be displayed for anonymous users, as that's not really a necessary thing.

Besides, during my tests, I was able to create issues trough the issue collector when the setting to allow unassigned issues was turned off. The default assignee would be set anyway.

Since the issue creation flow works as expected, preventing the creation or edition of the issue collectors when the general setting is turned off does not make much sense.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create an issue collector;
* Turn off the setting *Allow unassigned issues* at General settings (https://<YOUR SITE>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewApplicationProperties.jspa)
* Attempt to modify the form of the existing issue collector (e.g. add a field and try to save it).

h3. Expected Results

The changes will be saved.

h3. Actual Results

The changes are not saved. An message is displayed stating the following:
{code}
You cannot create an issue collector for this project, because the following fields are required on the project and those field types cannot be displayed to anonymous users. If the field is changed to be optional or a default…
{code}

h3. Workaround

In case you want to have the setting *Allow unassigned issues* off, and still use issue collectors, you can turn on that setting when you need to edit an existing issue collector, or create a new one. 
Turn the setting off afterwards.
fields.summary: You cannot create or edit an issue collector when the setting to allow unassigned issues is turned off

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JIRA cannot interpret and render valid URLs that have curly brackets in them. This makes it impossible to reference source document IDs from Office 365
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open onenote and copy the page link from one of your sample pages.
 # Open any issues in Jira -> click on  "Add web link"
    !image-2021-01-07-17-09-46-436.png|width=198,height=95!
 # Paste the weblink retrieved from the sharepoint, which looks something like below : 
{code:java}
https://yyyy.sharepoint.com/sites/AIARC/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=\{9ba83192-0dfd-4fd9-8223-d6a3136861b4}&action=edit&wd=target%2850000%20-%20Generaci%C3%B3n%20de%20vistas.one%7Cc5ba0fd9-d6cd-4f55-b7c8-11a09f22e86c%2F52000%20Reproducci%C3%B3n%20volum%C3%A9trica%7C55c91940-a7c3-44d1-a785-182963bb5135%2F%29&wdorigin=703{code}

h3. Expected Results

Link should be added in the one note page.
h3. Actual Results

The links are distorted, even though these are valid URLs. We have not been able to find a workaround for this issue.

A short demo on the same : 

!Jira_rendering_links.gif|width=533,height=250!
h3. Workaround

Replace the curly braces with URL encoding for the brackets
%7B for open bracket

%7D for close bracket
{code}
sourcedoc=\{9ba83192-0dfd-4fd9-8223-d6a3136861b4}&
sourcedoc=%7B9ba83192-0dfd-4fd9-8223-d6a3136861b4%7D&
{code}
fields.summary: JIRA won't render links that contain curly or Square brackets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *DELETE* method for rest/api/3/issue (used to delete issues), will error out (400s mentioning system error and 500s) when deleting *sub-tasks* if:

* You send multiple calls at the same time and,
* The sub-tasks belong to the same parent

(!) I tested this with around 5 sub-tasks, the more the likelyhood of error increases

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create around 5 sub-tasks under the same parent
# Send 5 DELETE /rest/api/3/issue calls to delete the sub-tasks *at the same time*.

In my tests, I used curl with the '&' joiner, to ensure calls were fired at the same time, as below:
{code}
curl -u <e-mail>:<api_token> -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/GAN-31  -w "%{http_code}" & \
curl -u <e-mail>:<api_token> -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/GAN-32 -w "%{http_code}" & \
curl -u <e-mail>:<api_token> -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/GAN-33 -w "%{http_code}" & \
curl -u <e-mail>:<api_token> -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/GAN-34 -w "%{http_code}" & \
curl -u <e-mail>:<api_token> -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/GAN-35 -w "%{http_code}"
{code}


h3. Expected Results

The calls will return 2xx responses and the sub-tasks deleted

h3. Actual Results

We receive 400s that mention "System errors" in the payload and also 500s

h3. Workaround

Make synchronous calls (where the next call will only start after the initial previous one finished). I tested and this works in Curl by using the ';' command joiner, which ensures synchronicity.

{code}
curl -u <e-mail>:<api_token> -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/GAN-25 -w "%{http_code}" ; \
curl -u <e-mail>:<api_token> -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/GAN-26  -w "%{http_code}" ; \
curl -u <e-mail>:<api_token> -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/GAN-27 -w "%{http_code}" ; \
curl -u <e-mail>:<api_token> -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/GAN-28 -w "%{http_code}" ; \
curl -u <e-mail>:<api_token> -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/GAN-29 -w "%{http_code}" ; \
curl -u <e-mail>:<api_token> -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/GAN-30 -w "%{http_code}"
{code}
fields.summary: Concurrent DELETE issue API calls will error when the issues are from the same parent

fields.description:

When using Jira Cloud for Mac, the attachments section has only one type of view (Strip view) and, when an issue has more than three attachments, no arrow icon is shown (as the web version).

Issues with unmapped status not showing as swimlane in the mobile app.

The kanban board swimlanes are grouped by stories on web and mobile app.
h3. Actual Results

When an issue is using an unmapped status but a subtask is using a mapped status the issue appears as a swimlane in the web version but not in the mobile app.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When automation has a project archived is in scope it will show the error "*Either you or the rule actor for this rule is missing some required permissions*" in Edit issue action.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Automation for Jira rule.
 # Select any trigger.
 # Then, add the new action *"Edit issue".*
 # Select a field to be edited, e.g.: *Description*.
 # Set a project into the scope, e.g.: *Project to be archived*.
 # Then, archive the project. 
 # Try to edit the rule and save the changes.

*[Video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/JruqEAPg]* with all the steps.
h3. Expected Results
 * Archived projects should be removed from the rule scope.
 * Or, we should be able to change the rule without this error.

h3. Actual Results

When we try to edit the action "*Edit issue*" will show the message "*Either you or the rule actor for this rule is missing some required permissions:*".
h3. Workaround

Remove the archived project from the rule scope.
fields.summary: When automation has a project archived in scope it will show an error in Edit issue action

fields.description:
The "{{IN}}" operator is used to search for issues where the value of the specified field is one of multiple specified values.

The "{{NOT IN}}" operator is used to search for issues where the value of the specified field is not one of multiple specified values.

It would be a great feature to be able to search if the reporter/assignee is the approver.
fields.summary: Include the Approvers field in the operator IN and NOT IN

fields.description:
*Summary*

In an existing configuration, after the fix provided in BUG JRACLOUD-72479, the values in Custom fields *Text Only (Read-only)* are not cleared using the workflow Post function "Clear Field Value". 

Also, if the the post function "Clear Field Value" was to be configured newly on any Workflow transition, the option to select these *Text Only (Read-only)* custom fields do not appear in the _Field to clear_ dropdown list.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Create a Custom field of type *Text Only (Read-only),* associate it with an issue type. 
 # On any transition of the workflow associated with that issue type, add post function "Clear Field Value"
 # In the next step, in the _Field to clear_ dropdown list, the Custom field of type *Text Only (Read-only)* is not seen as one of the option to be selected.

*Expected Results*
 * While newly configuring a workflow, we should be able to select these Read only Custom field to be added to the post function "Clear Field Value".
 * In an already existing configuration, when the transition with post function "Clear Field Value" is executed, the values in the read only custom fields should be cleared.  

*Workaround*

No workaround known
fields.summary: For Text Only custom fields, values cannot be edited using the workflow post function "Clear Field Value"

fields.description:
"Code" blocks on an Issue page are fixed width. Even when I have a really wide screen, I cannot see enough of the code block, just the left part of it. At the same time, I see on the Issue page huge white spaces completely wasted. Also, the Issuer details on the right should be possible to hide, like the left sidebar. All the freed up space should be allowed to be used by the Issue comments, including making wider code blocks.
This problem makes me to copy and paste the cod blocks with decent UI to work with them. It is a bad user experience. 
Please use the desktop space more frugally, and allow to expand the code blocks.
fields.summary: Better use desktop real estate

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attaching an attachment while commenting in Jira old issue view, using certain resolution and Windows scaling will result in a dialog box size that is too big for user to proceed.
 !image-2021-01-05-11-16-11-941.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach a screenshot in a comment with below configuration:
#* Windows environment (reproduced in Windows 10).
#* Resolution is 1920x1080.
#* Windows scaling set to 150%.

h3. Expected Results

The dialog box is resized for all button to be visible on the screen or provide a scroll bar.

h3. Actual Results

The button to proceed with attaching the screenshot will be out of bound - unable to click.

h3. Workaround

Use browser zoom to zoom out or set Windows scaling to 125%.
fields.summary: Pasting attachment in comment dialog box is too big

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When downloading multiple files from a ticket, using the *Download all* option the files have an incorrect modified date when the .zip file is extracted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a ticket with more than one attachment.
# At the attachment section click on actions "..." (the three dots).
# Select the *Download all* option.
# Extract the downloaded file.

h3. Expected Results

The extracted files have the Date modified that matches the date created.

h3. Actual Results

The extracted files have the Date modified from matching the UTC (GMT-O) time of when the file was downloaded, and it can be in the future of the current date/time.

Example below:

The file was downloaded on Monday, 4 January 2021 16:57 (GMT-3), but the date modified of the file displays as Monday, 4 January 2021 19:57 (which was 3 hours in the future for me).

 !date modified.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Downloading one file at a time the issue doesn't occur.
fields.summary: Attachments have a date modified in UTC (GMT-0) when downloaded using the Download all option

A preview like the one provided by *OfficeOnline* is desirable.

Orphaned workflows in next-gen projects cause project deletion to fail

Share Dialog box on new issue view does not populate the field where you enter the name, team or email, if you start typing you will trigger the shortcut keys.

*New Issue View*
[^NewIssueView.webm]

*Old Issue View*

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using a uppercase issue key on pull request creation event also triggers rules with Branch Created trigger event though no branch was created
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect to GitHub
 # In a project, create a A4J rule with Branch created trigger
 # Create a PR with that branch, using in name the key of another ticket in uppercase
 # Even though no branch was created in the pull request event, the rule with Branch created trigger will be executed and the branch is shown on the issue's view screen on dev panel.

h3. Expected Results

Only rules with Pull request created trigger should be executed.
h3. Actual Results

Rules that has Branch created event as trigger is also executed even though no branch was created during pull request creation event.
h3. Workaround

There is now workaround for this yet.
fields.summary: Using a uppercase issue key on pull request creation event also triggers rules with Branch Created trigger

It would be nice if there is a way to get the first issue on the rank of a status. 

For example: for the active sprint, I want to get the first issue on the "To do" status:
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-30 at 12.05.43.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you edit the link name of "Cloners", the default clone link, if you try to clone an issue you'll get an error informing that a link to the original issue won't be created.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Cog > Issues > Issue linking
# Click on Edit near to Cloners and change it to Clone (for example)
# Click on Save
# Try to clone any issue

h3. Expected Results
A clone should be created with a link to the original issue. If editing the original link breaks the link creation while cloning an issue, it shouldn't be possible to edit the original config.

h3. Actual Results
A clone is created but there is a message informing that the link to the original issue won't be created.

{code}The clone link type "Cloners" does not exist. A link to the original issue will not be created.{code}

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
The Workaround described for Cloud instances here: [The Clone Link Type 'Cloners' Does Not Exist Due to Missing Property |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/The+Clone+Link+Type+%27Cloners%27+Does+Not+Exist+Due+to+Missing+Property]
fields.summary: Editing the link name "Cloners" prevent link creation while cloning issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The *Average Time in Status* gadget shows erroneous result in graph.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard
 # Add an *Average Time in Status* gadget to it
 # Find an issue that was created in the current month and stayed in the selected status for longer than a day
 # Create a JQL filter as: key = <issue key of the issue found>
 # Use the filter above in the gadget 
 # Configure the gadget length of periods represented on the graph as *daily*

See example below:
* Filter used is:
{code}
key = RT2-6
{code}
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
* Gadget is using status *To Do*
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
* RT2-6 was created on December 19, 2020, 8:54 PM and transitioned from *To Do* to *Done* on December 22, 2020, 6:48 PM.
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 
* Graph displays values in the wrong period as screen-shot shows below:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Gadget graph would consider and display the values for the issue correctly

h3. Actual Results
Gadget graph does not consider nor display erroneous values.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there isn't one.
fields.summary: Average Time in Status gadget shows erroneous result in graph

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The *Average Time in Status* gadget does not show current month to date if Period is set to Monthly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard
 # Add an *Average Time in Status* gadget to it
 # Find an issue that was created in the current month and stayed in the selected status for longer than a day
 # Create a JQL filter as: key = <issue key of the issue found>
 # Use the filter above in the gadget 
 # Configure the gadget length of periods represented on the graph as *Monthly*

h3. Expected Results
Gadget graph would consider and display the values for the issue of the current month

h3. Actual Results
Gadget graph does not consider nor display the values for the issue of the current month

h3. Workaround
Do not use *Monthly* period in your gadget configuration.
fields.summary: Average Time in Status gadget does not show current month to date if Period is set to Monthly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Comments and attachments are duplicated when added with email. The email must contain a high amount of attachments.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send an email containing 500 example (the amount might variate)
 # Verify the issue where the comment should be added

h3. Expected Results

Comments and attachments are added once.
h3. Actual Results

Comments and attachments are duplicated. Attachments fail to load.
h3. Workaround

Split the attachments in multiple emails.
fields.summary: Comments and attachments are duplicated when added with email

fields.description:
I want to integrate the department attribute of users with a custom field(Manager) of projects.

Ex.
We have "IT Help" project. While creating a ticket in IT Help, The custom attribute of the Manager field displayed a particular group's members using group picker. We need to map department attribute instead of group picker.
fields.summary: integrate the department attribute of users with a custom field(Manager) of projects.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Version Updated Event (jira:version_updated) Sometimes Provides Inaccurate Information.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a webhook for Project related events: *Version released* and *Version updated*
# Release a Version from a Project.
# Webhook will send two events - i.e., one for *Version updated* and other one for *Version released*.

h3. Expected Results
In the *Version updated* event body, the value for "released" should be 'true'.

h3. Actual Results
The value for "release" in the *Version updated* event body is showing as 'false'.

{code}
{
  "timestamp": 1609203508853,
  "webhookEvent": "jira:version_updated",
  "version": {
    "self": "https://sniperx.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/version/10033",
    "id": "10033",
    "description": "",
    "name": "PB Release 1",
    "archived": false,
    "released": false,
    "overdue": false,
    "userStartDate": "01/Feb/21",
    "userReleaseDate": "28/Feb/21",
    "projectId": 10074
  }
}
{code}

However, *Version released* event body shows correct value for "released".
{code}
{
  "timestamp": 1609203509200,
  "webhookEvent": "jira:version_released",
  "version": {
    "self": "https://sniperx.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/version/10033",
    "id": "10033",
    "description": "",
    "name": "PB Release 1",
    "archived": false,
    "released": true,
    "overdue": false,
    "userStartDate": "01/Feb/21",
    "userReleaseDate": "28/Feb/21",
    "projectId": 10074
  }
}
{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Version Updated Event Sometimes Provides Inaccurate Information

fields.description:
h6. USER STORY:

As Jira user I want to get notified when search results in my filter change, so that I would know if any issues are added or leave the filter.

 
h6. DESCRIPTION:

Currently users can subscribe to filters and get notified on certain dates.

!image-2020-12-29-11-56-11-308.png|width=229,height=193!

This suggestion is to provide users with an option for the notifications to go out whenever the search results change(issues that match the filter conditions are added or removed).
fields.summary: Get notified on filter search results changes

When a user profile language is set to "Russian", the top navigation bar is partially translated. Only "People" gets translated.

Issue Type icons are not shown in the Issue type name has a larger character set in their name
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Issue type with a long name and upload a custom icon for it.
 # Try Creating an issue using the newly created issue type on the backlog or as a child of an EPIC.
 # The Custom Issue type Icons are not shown 

h3. Expected Results

The dropdown should show the Issue type Icon. 
h3. Actual Results

Issue type Icons do not show and we only see the name of the issue type.

!Screenshot 2020-12-24 at 6.27.25 PM.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the "average time in status" gadget with the dashboard, we see that the graph is generated incorrectly returning the issues that were not in resolved state. Ideally, the gadget should only retrieve the issue that are in resolved state.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project where different issuetypes have different workflows.
  !image-2020-12-24-14-31-33-849.png|width=388,height=118!
 # Use a filter with only this project and use this filter in the *Average Time In Status* gadget OR use this project. !image-2020-12-24-14-31-47-192.png|width=289,height=86!
 # Select a status which is not common among all the issuetypes in the project.
 # The result shown is incorrect wherein the chart is unable to determine the resolution status of those issuetypes that don't use the selected status in the workflow. 
!image-2020-12-24-14-32-25-509.png|width=286,height=130!

h3. Expected Results

The gadget should result only those issues that were resolved.
h3. Actual Results

We see issues that were never resolved and we do not see all issues that were in unresolved state.
h3. Workaround

Ensure that the filter includes a specific issue type to get accurate results

!image-2020-12-24-14-30-27-136.png|width=319,height=69!
fields.summary: "Average Time In Status" gadget displays inaccurate results

fields.description:
We customize all the issue types by including custom fields to match our business. Was working on including these Custom Fields for all existing Projects. It took more than twice the time I would have spent because the Screen Scheme listing while configuring was not sorted. Scrolling up and down looking for my Scheme consumed the maximum portion of the time. Rendering a sorted list will be a great usability enhancement.

Surprised how this point was missed by Atlassian's UX Team during QA.
fields.summary: Implement Sorting on "Screen Scheme" drop down entries in the page "Configure" page of "Issue Type Screen Schemes"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JSM or JSW projects fail to be deleted if group that was a default member of a project role when the project was created is deleted in the User Management.
h3. Steps to Reproduce (JSM)
 # Create a user group in the UM
 # Add the group as a default member of a project role (*Jira settings* > *System* > *Project roles* > *Manage Default Members*)
 # Create a JSM project
 # Delete the group
 # Try to delete the project

h3. Steps to Reproduce (JSW)
 # Create a user group in the UM
 # Add the group as a default member of a project role (*Jira settings* > *System* > *Project roles* > *Manage Default Members*)
 # Create a JSW project
 # Move the project to Trash
 # Try to permanently delete the project

h3. Expected Results

The project is permanently deleted.
h3. Actual Results
 * Project still shows in the list of Projects (JSM) / Project remains on Trash (JSW).
 * Project lose the association with the Permission scheme and Issue type scheme.

h3. Workaround

Recreating the deleted group in the User Management makes it possible to permanently delete the project.
fields.summary: Cannot delete JSM project and cannot permanently delete JSW project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you use the function {{{{xyz.compareTo(now)}}}}, it doens't work correctly if the "xyz" is in another month - it return "1" in the results.

Example:
 xyz = 2021-02-23
 now = 2020-12-23
 {{{{xyz.compareTo(now)}}}} = 1
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create a rule similar to the one below:
 !image-2020-12-23-17-56-39-950.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

Bring the exact difference between the dates.
h3. Actual Results

Results equal to 1
h3. Workaround

Use the following function:
{code:java}
{{now.diff(xyz).days}}
{code}
fields.summary: The function {{xyz.compareTo(now)}} don't work if the "xyz" results is in another month

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to delete project from trash if non-existing group is in the people section.
This only happens if a group, which is added to the respective people section of the project is deleted after the project was moved to the trash.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a group to the people section of a project
 # Send the project to the trash
 # Delete the respective group 
 # Try to delete the project from the trash

h3. Expected Results
Project would be deleted.

h3. Actual Results
Project is not deleted with no error.

h3. Workaround
# Restore the project
# Re-create the missing group with the same name
# From this point, you can either remove the group from the people section of the restored project or delete the project before deleting the group
fields.summary: Unable to delete project from trash if non-existing group is in the people section

fields.description:

Last seen date is updated after a successful login into Jira (JSW, JSM or Jira Core).
Last seen date can be found in the user detail in the user management for your site.

h3. Expected Results
Last Seen date is updated

h3. Actual Results
Last Seen date is not updated

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Logging in into Jira does not update Last Seen

fields.description:

If the user tries to delete a component that has issues associated with it, the "Something's gone wrong" error will pop-up and prevent the user to move forward.
 !image-2020-12-23-11-58-43-473.png|width=271,height=110!

 # Choose a component that has issues associated
 # Hi the three dots (...) for more options and then "*Delete*"
 # The "Something's gone wrong" error will pop-up

h3. Expected Results

The association wizard should be shown to assign issues with this component to another one.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the browser console:
{noformat}
vendor~748942c6.4f1dcff5ab67214aa49d.8.js:24 Error: Minified React error #137; visit https://reactjs.org/docs/error-decoder.html?invariant=137&args[]=input&args[]= for the full message or use the non-minified dev environment for full errors and additional helpful warnings.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Atlassian accounts with ID starting with numbers are shown as unknown in CSV (Watchers only).

Example: 557058:xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add watchers to a ticket (new and old Atlassian accounts)

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer gets a blank screen while trying to complete the Google SSO in Jira Cloud Mobile app in "Work profile".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the *Jira Cloud by Atlassian* mobile app in Android for Work profile.
 # Use the "*Continue with Google*" option to Login.
 # The user would get a blank screen page while trying to login.

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to use the app like it works in the Normal mode.
h3. Actual Results

 Users get a Blank screen while trying to complete the Login SSO.
h3. Workaround

Install the app in Normal Android mode(Not in Work profile) and that works fine.
fields.summary: Unable to login to Jira Cloud Mobile app using Google SSO in Android work profiles

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to transition issue to first item from list of transitions on Big Sur
h3. Steps to Reproduce

h3. Expected Results

Transition type is visible and can be selected

fields.description:
|h3. *Atlassian Update - 28 July 2021*|
|Hi everyone,
  
 Thank you again for your patience. We will be rolling out an improvement to this problem in upcoming days/week. Here are the expected changes coming your way as a result of the roll-out
  
 * All external links that used to be missing when switching from old to new view should now be visible
 * Phabricator links will be grouped under text “Phabricator” instead of text “Implemented in”. This is true for other links. We will no longer group applications by relationships, but rather by application name {color:#505f79}(such change aims to make it more explicit to users what type of app/link is being grouped together, because the current text of "implemented in" is a free-text field defined by each app individually){color}
 * Links will be sorted old to new, the same pattern in the current “Web links” section of the new issue view
 * Links are now displayed in a paginated manner, starting with 10 links and then 50 more, each time “Show more” is clicked.
 * New limit: There will be a 1000 link limit on the overall number of visible external links|

 
 Thanks
 Atlassian Cloud Team|

 

We have this feature request JRACLOUD-70833 to fix the external links in the new issue view but this is not including third party links like [Phabricator|https://secure.phabricator.com/T5422], this ticket is to add that possibility, the old issue view will not be available on March 31, 2021, so it will be good if this is added before that.
fields.summary: Phabricator third party software remote links works only in the old issue view

fields.description: When you clone a *Resolved* ticket, we naturally reset the workflow status to *Open*. The same should happen with the *Epic Status* field. Users get bit by this when their Epics don't appear on their agile boards. Not really sure if *Epic Status* adds any value to begin since it seems duplicative of the issue's status.
fields.summary: Cloning an Epic should reset the Epic Status field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue descriptions containing tables with merged cells are not retrievable using the REST API.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a spreadsheet such as Excel or Google sheets, copy a range of singular (non-merged) cells.
 # Past the cells into an issue description and validate that the table renders correctly.
 # Query the REST API with https://sometenant.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/\{issueKey}?expand=renderedFields
 # In a spreadsheet such as Excel or Google sheets, merge two cells together and copy a range of cells including the merged cells.
 # Past the cells into an issue description and validate that the table renders correctly.
 # Query the REST API with https://sometenant.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/\{issueKey}?expand=renderedFields

h3. Expected Results

At steps 3 and 6, the value of the description field accurately reflect the table in the issue description.
h3. Actual Results

At step 3, the value of the description field accurately reflect the table in the issue description.

At step 6, the value of the description field shows <!-- ADF macro (type = 'table') --> in place of the table.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Tables with merged cells not retrievable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we have two mail handlers that can process messages from the same project a race condition messages to be processed intermittently.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 Mail Handlers using the same mail server (can use the default one on Jira)
 ## The first handler will be used by a specific project to create issues;
 ## The second handler will be used for all projects to only process comments. We won't specify projects here
 # Send a couple of messages to Jira.
 # The messages will be processed intermittently;
 # Remove the comments mail handler;
 # All messages will be processed correctly.

h3. Expected Results

The mail handlers will be able to determine which one to use based on the action the user is performing. If there are no issues to add a comment into, Jira will be able to create the ticket in the destination project. If an issue exists, Jira will be able to place the comment correctly.
h3. Actual Results

Jira will intermittently fail depending on which handler will effectively process the message.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Race condition on mail handler causes messages to be processed intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sprint drop down does not include some sprints if the list exceeds 10 Sprints with continuous name attribute

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create new Jira Software project with Sprint Board
* Create Sprint with name "Sprint 20.1"
* Create new sprints with automatic name until reaching "Sprint 20.20"
* Should be Sprint 20.2, Sprint 20.3, Sprint 20.4, ...
* Create new issue with Create Issue dialog
* Try to select sprint by typing "20.1"

h3. Expected Results
User is able to select "Sprint 20.1"

h3. Actual Results
User can only select 20.12 to 20.19.

h3. Workaround

Change the name of the Sprint, then select it from the Sprint list.
fields.summary: Sprint drop down does not include some sprints if the list exceeds 10 Sprints with continuous name attribute

fields.description:
In a private browser and moving between an initiative and an epic with advanced roadmaps enabled, the issue is reliably replicated.

This bug is a sub-bug, reported for the initiative-epic navigation experience, of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-75656.

Details from parent bug:

Steps to Reproduce

Open an issue and navigate to related issues like linked issues.
h3. Expected Results

We should see the full details of the issue we navigated to.
h3. Actual Results

While the URL shows the issue key of the navigated issue, the details page still shows the details of the previous issue.
h3. Workaround

Refreshing the page loads the actual content completely.
fields.summary: New issue view page sometimes does not update when you navigate between epic and initiative when navigating in Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
There are a number of different ways this can be accomplished. 

One simple way would be to provide a "default" quick filter that is applied to the board by default and must be explicitly removed. 

The issue is that issue security doesn't work in sprint planning (exposes secure issues if the scrum master has access to them). 

Another option would be to have a way to "mirror" the current board in another board with additional filters applied. 

 

If this isn't something you're going to fix, can you suggest a workaround that doesn't require a bunch of duplicate labour?  One option I explored was just creating a second sprint, but this requires keeping working days in-sync manually and it's not entirely clear what to do about the Roadmap.
fields.summary: Scrum Boards that Play Well with Issue Security

h3. Issue Summary

Attach an image on comments on the new issue view shows it not resized in the old view.

*New view:*

!image-2020-12-17-15-32-56-890.png|thumbnail!

*Old view:*

!image-2020-12-17-15-32-30-802.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a Jira issue in the new issue view
 # Upload/paste/drop a large image to the comment field and it will be ok on the new issue view

h3. Expected Results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You cannot create or edit issue collectors if the option *Allow unassigned issues* is set to *OFF* in the general settings. That happens because the *Assignee* field is set as required by default, but it cannot be used in the issue collector.

The problem is that when you have that option disabled, and you try to perform one the mentioned actions with an issue collector, no error message will be displayed. The issue collector will just not be updated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*  Turn the option *Allow unassigned issues* off in the general settings: *https://<INSTANCE NAME>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/EditApplicationProperties!default.jspa*
* Attempt to edit an existing issue collector;
** E.g. try to add a custom field to its form.

Here's a recording showing the behaviour:  [^Issue collector edition fail.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results

An error message will be displayed, stating the reason why the issue collector was not updated.

h3. Actual Results

The issue collector just won't be updated, and no error message will be displayed.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Issue collector edition fails silently when "Allow unassigned issues" is turned off

fields.description:
*Problem statement* -

Currently, if we want to copy a value from a parent to subtask in *next-gen projects* (for eg. priority), the rule will not support that and will not identify the parent.

The same issue has been discussed here - [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Marketplace-Apps-Integrations/Automation-Subtasks-won-t-pick-up-Parent-information-Next-Gen/qaq-p/1360520]

 

*Expected behaviour* - Copy from parent option should work for subtasks in the next-gen project

*Actual behaviour* - The audit will show an error - 
*(Could not find valid 'id' or 'name' in priority object. (priority))*
fields.summary: Automation rule doesn't recognise parent for a subtask in next-gen preventing users from copying the values
